alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 4:47PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL, NORTHWESTERN HARDING AND EAST CENTRAL MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 446 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Roy, or 19 miles northwest of Mosquero, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roy, Mills, Chicosa Lake State Park and Solano. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County
